question.title: What will the United States score on the 2025 Corruption Perceptions Index?
question.description:
Every year, [Transparency International](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transparency_International) releases an updated version of its [Corruption Perceptions Index](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Corruption_Perceptions_Index), a global index and ranking of every country in the world based on their perceived levels of [public-sector corruption](https://www.transparency.org/en/news/how-cpi-scores-are-calculated). Countries are scored on a scale from 0 (most corrupt) to 100 (least corrupt, also referred to as most transparent).

In 2024, Denmark [scored the highest](https://www.transparency.org/en/cpi/2024) on the Corruption Perceptions Index, with a score of 90. Lowest was South Sudan, with a score of 8. The United States tied the Bahamas at 28th in the rankings, with a score of 65. That marked the U.S.'s [lowest-ever score on the index](https://www.transparency.org/en/cpi/2024/index/usa) since the 100-point scale was adopted in 2012.
question.resolution_criteria: This question will resolve as the score of the United States on the [2025 Corruption Perceptions Index](https://www.transparency.org/en/cpi), as published by Transparency International.
question.fine_print: If the 2025 Corruption Perceptions Index is not published before May 1, 2026, or if it is published but not on a 100-point scale, this question will be annulled.
question.short_title: What will U.S. score on 2025 Corruption Perceptions Index?
